title: Manchester United identify Julian Nagelsmann as future manager
text:
Julian Nagelsmann has impressed Manchester United chiefs (Picture: Bongarts/Getty Images)

With Ole Gunnar Solskjaer under immense pressure, Manchester United are beginning to consider their options as to who could leave the club in the right direction, should Solskjaer be given the boot.

Solskjaer has seen his side amass just eight points from eight Premier League matches at the start of the season and his future is under serious scrutiny after a 1-0 defeat to relegation-threatened Newcastle.

It’s thought Manchester United chiefs could pull the trigger on the Norwegian should bitter rivals and Premier League table toppers Liverpool dish out a pasting when the two sides meet after the international break.

But regardless of how long they ultimately stick with Solskjaer, Nagelsmann has been earmarked as a Manchester United manager of the future, according to the Daily Mail.

Advertisement

Just 32, Red Bull Leipzig boss Nagelsmann is already on his second job in Germany’s top flight, having become the youngest manager in Bundesliga history when appointed by Hoffenheim at 28.

While United are two points off the relegation zone, Nagelsmann’s Leipzig are two points off league leaders Borussia Monchengladbach following his arrival in the summer.

It would be difficult to prise the German away at this early stage into his time at Leipzig – he is contracted until 2023 – but United are doing their due dilligence and are ready to hire one of Europe’s hottest managerial prospects in the future.
